definition: Confucian moral injunctions of fidelity/piety to one's parents, respect to one's older brother, loyalty to one's monarch, faith to one's male friends
filial piety or obedience/mourning apparel
to do one's duty as a younger brother
loyal/devoted/honest
letter/mail/CL:封[feng1]/to trust/to believe/to profess faith in/truthful/confidence/trust/at will/at random
filial piety and fraternal duty
sense of propriety, justice, integrity and honor (i.e. the four social bonds, 四維|四维[si4 wei2])
instructions to one's children/family precepts
righteousness/justice
to regulate the family and rule the state (idiom)
the teaching of Confucius and Mencius
filial piety (Confucian virtue)/to be a good son or daughter
restrain yourself and return to the rites (idiom, from Analects); to subdue self and observe proprieties/(any number of possible translations)
kindhearted and moderate (idiom); temperate and gentle
brotherly bond

three principles and five virtues (idiom)/the three rules (ruler guides subject, father guides son and husband guides wife) and five constant virtues of Confucianism (benevolence 仁, righteousness 義|义, propriety 禮|礼, wisdom 智 and fidelity 信)
the way of one's conduct and interaction in society (idiom)
benevolent father, filial son (idiom)/natural love between parents and children
Confucian school, founded by Confucius 孔子[Kong3 zi3] (551-479 BC) and Mencius 孟子[Meng4 zi3] (c. 372-c. 289 BC)
Bade or Pate city in Taoyuan county 桃園縣|桃园县[Tao2 yuan2 xian4], north Taiwan
to see profit and remember morality (idiom); to act ethically/not tempted by riches
